Articles.Content:
I have seen the following launches( in no particular order).

Antares:

Orb-D,

Orb-1

Orb-3(the one that blew up).

Ariane 5:

Amazonas-3/ Azersat-1

Intelsat-30/ARSAT-1.

Soyuz ST:

O3B 2 and 3.

Minotaur V:

LADEE

Atlas V:

MAVEN

CLIO.

World View 3.

MUOS-3

Falcon 9 1.1:

Cassiope.

Orbcomm 1

SPX-4.

SPX-5

Delta IV:

GPS-2F

Orion EFT-1.

GSSAP

Delta II:

SMAP

OCO-2

post the launches you've seen either live or on live stream in the format I used.

Edited March 17, 2015 by DarthVader

Hey this is a cute thread, I'll participate!

Antares:

Orb-3

sad D:

Falcon 9 v1.1:

SES-8

Ariane V:

ATV-5

Delta IV:

EFT-1

had to stay up all night twice in a row for this one >: P

GSLV Mk. III:

CARE

Huh I've only seen five that sucks...well I hope to at least see Spx-5 and Angara A5 launch this month!

barge<3

None...

If I watch the stream the launch is invariably cancelled. 7 launches now.
A variety of F9 launches, I also stayed up to watch the Chang'e 5-T1 launch but the live stream was cancelled.

Too many to remember. To reduce it to notable ones;

GRAIL

Gaofen-1

Chang'e 3

Hayabusa 2

Orion EFT-1

Shenzhou 10

Tiangong 1

Antares maiden launch

Naro-1 orbital launch

Proton launch on 2/7/13 (the one that blew up)

If I watch the stream the launch is invariably cancelled. 7 launches now.

They can't cancel all of them.

They can't cancel all of them.

Challenge accepted...

Challenge accepted...

In the past few years I can't think of a single orbital launch that was actually cancelled. You need to pay more attention to news about scrubs and aborts.

In the past few years I can't think of a single orbital launch that was actually cancelled. You need to pay more attention to news about scrubs and aborts.

When I say cancelled I mean delayed until a later date. Which I've happened to have missed each time.

Really hard to remember:

Atlas V:

Curiosity launch

Falcon 9:

2 or 3 launches

STS:

Um, a few?

Delta IV:

EFT-1

I've watched several SpaceX and JAXA launches on a live stream.

Never seen an actual orbital launch in real life. I did get to see a high-power rocketry event in Alabama (where I am attending college) in October.

I havent seen one in person, though I've watched these on TV

Sts-126

Sts-134

Sts-135

LADEE

ORB-1

Edited December 19, 2014 by gooddog15

Space Shuttle Atlantis:

STS-86

Visit to the Space Station Mir

I went to see the Space Shuttle with my dad in 1997. I believe it was STS 86. Im not sure. However I remember that the shuttle was Atlantis, I could and should google it before I post this but I am on my phone. So I am sure someone can fact check me. Anyway hands down one of the coolest things I have ever seen.

Edited December 19, 2014 by sp1989
Added two launches.
Only two... that one that blew up, and the MMS Atlas 5 launch a few nights ago.
IRL or on stream? If on stream, I try to watch as many as I can, and I've seen almost all of them since 2012, but never in RL

That ain't easy... I haven't seen many, especially because I'm 16 and I'm from Europe, but still it's difficult to remember all of them.

For sure:

2013

- Landsat 8 (My first ever live launch!)

- LADEE

2014

At least five or six, but I have no idea which.

2015

- SpaceX CRS-5

- SMAP

- Vega IXV

- DSCOVR

- Eutelsat 115 West B/ABS-3A

- MMS

This year is my year, I can feel it!

Update with new launches I've seen (mainly for me):

- GPS 2F-9

- ISS 42S

- Galileo FOC-2

Edited March 27, 2015 by Frida Space

I saw a space shuttle launch once. I was in second grade. We were down the beach a ways from KSC so we could only see the smoke trail snaking into the sky. It was probably one of the coolest things I have ever seen.

I have live next to Vandenberg AFB for the last 30 years, so I can't remember them all.

Well 40 miles away from it, but rockets are bright even in day light and leave long smoke trails.

I also grew up next to a Rocketdyne test facility. I know it's not the same thing, but listening to Shuttle engines so loud that they shake the picture frames out of alinement at home has a big impact on a little kid.

Ok I have seen a few:

The Proton Launch from today

ORB-3 (that was quite a shocker)

LADEE (saw with the naked eye from Pennsylvania)

the GSLV MK.3 test

a few F9 launches

the Orion test launch

STS-135

SMAP

the launch of ATV Georges Lemaitre

the launch of Swarm (I think that was on a Rockot)

some random Minotaur I launch (I think it was the record breaking one)

And a Zenit launch from the ocean

Also those of you who were alive during Apollo, I envy you
None.... I'm a 15 year old Canadian.

None.... I'm a 15 year old Canadian.

Well it's time to start Winnipeg Suborbital then......

I saw all the manned launches from birth (mom was a space nut) until some point in the STS program. So Gemini IV to Challenger, then a bunch after that, but more spotty. A couple with my eyeballs, but those were just sounding rockets.

Orion EFT

MAVEN

These are the only two I've seen, but to be fair, I'm the only one in my family that cares for all that space stuff (17 YO btw)

I watched the rosseta landing if that counts (yes i know the lander wan't called rosseta, but i can't spell philleay or whatever it is)
sadly, I have not seen any live launches (or landings). I have watched several shuttle launches on tv though!
